data.title: India state bank dollar sales anchor rupee, investors await GDP data
data.description:
By Jaspreet Kalra

The Indian rupee was treading water on Friday near the psychologically important 91-per-dollar mark, wedged between elevated dollar demand on account of maturing non-deliverable forward contracts and dollar sales from state-run banks.

The Asian currency was at 90.95 per dollar, down marginally from its close at 90.9050 in the previous session.

Investors await India's GDP data for October-December, which would be the first under a new series which will improve accuracy and use more granular price deflation to address concerns raised by economists. A Reuters poll forecasts year-on-year growth at 7.2%.

India's equity benchmarks, the BSE Sensex and Nifty 50 , were down about 0.7% each, underperforming regional stocks with the steepest cuts to financial stocks.

That, in addition to heightened demand to buy dollars at the daily reference rate, heaped pressure on the rupee, which was offset by state-banks' dollar offers, traders said.

The reference rate is a benchmark used to settle contracts and often attracts concentrated dollar buying or selling. It was last being traded at a 0.25/0.50 paisa premium, signalling demand for dollars.

The rupee has "steadied within narrow 90.85-90.95 range, as bunched-up maturing non-deliverables negated the benefit from a resumption in foreign equity inflows this month and a softer dollar," said Radhika Rao, senior economist at DBS.

Foreign investors have net purchased local stocks worth over $2.5 billion this month, a turnaround from three consecutive months of net outflows worth about $7 billion.

Changes to the deflator methodology under the new GDP series will be in focus for impact on nominal and real GDP growth, DBS' Rao said. Nominal and real GDP growth serve as important benchmarks for both local and foreign investors in Indian assets.

Nominal GDP reflects output measured at current market prices while real GDP adjusts for change in prices.

In global markets, the dollar index was steady at 97.7 while Asian currencies were flat to modestly weaker.

data.title: ZAWYA-PRESSR: HE Saeed Mohammed Al Tayer meets German State of Saarland Deputy Prime Minister
data.description:
Dubai, UAE: HE Saeed Mohammed Al Tayer, MD and CEO of Dubai Electricity and Water Authority (DEWA), welcomed HE Jürgen Barke, Minister of Economics, Innovation, Digitalisation and Energy and Deputy Prime Minister of the German State of Saarland, to explore opportunities for collaboration in renewable and clean energy.

The meeting was attended by officials from DEWA, including Marwan Bin Haidar, Executive Vice President of Innovation & the Future, and Dr Yousef Al Akraf, Executive Vice President of Business Support and Human Resources. It highlighted the UAE’s and Germany’s shared commitment to accelerating the global energy transition, promoting innovation in clean technologies and strengthening partnerships that support climate action and sustainable economic growth.

During the meeting, Al Tayer outlined DEWA’s flagship projects and strategic initiatives that reinforce Dubai’s position as a global hub for clean energy and green economy solutions.

Al Tayer provided an overview of the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Solar Park, the largest single-site solar park in the world based on the independent power producer (IPP) model, which will have a production capacity of more than 8,000 megawatts by 2030. The solar park plays a pivotal role in achieving the Dubai Clean Energy Strategy 2050 and the Dubai Net Zero Carbon Emissions Strategy 2050, which aims to provide 100% of the emirate's total power capacity from clean sources by 2050.

Al Tayer also highlighted DEWA’s pioneering Green Hydrogen project at the solar park, the first of its kind in the Middle East and North Africa to produce hydrogen using solar power. The project supports research and development efforts and explores the potential of green hydrogen as a clean fuel for mobility, industry and energy storage, contributing to the development of a sustainable hydrogen economy.

Al Tayer emphasised that DEWA continues to adopt the latest technologies in renewable energy, smart grids, energy storage and digital transformation to enhance efficiency, reliability and sustainability across its operations. He reaffirmed DEWA’s commitment to strengthening international cooperation and knowledge exchange to accelerate innovation in clean and renewable energy solutions.

For his part, Barke commended the UAE’s ambitious clean energy targets and DEWA’s leadership in implementing large-scale renewable energy projects.

For more information, please contact: Shaikha Almheiri / Mohammad Almheiri / Ribal Dayekh                                    

Dubai Electricity and Water Authority                                                                                             Seen Media

shaikha.almheiri@dewa.gov.ae / Mohammad.almheiri@dewa.gov.ae / Ribal.Dayekh@dewa.gov.ae

mariam@seenmedia.ae  / esraa@seenmedia.ae

For more information, please visit DEWA’s website www.dewa.gov.ae

data.title: Proximus reports annual core profit ahead of estimates
data.description:
Belgian telecom operator Proximus reported a 15.5% rise in its yearly core profit on Friday, driven by strong performance in its home market.

Reported group earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) came in at 2.3 billion euros ($2.7 billion), beating analysts' expectations of 2.1 billion euros in a company-compiled consensus.

data.title: Norway's Xplora Technologies Q4 revenue beats estimates on subscription boost
data.description:
Overview

  • Norway-based family tech firm's Q4 revenue grew, beating analyst expectations

  • Q4 EBITDA reached record high of NOK 101 mln

  • Company's subscription base grew 33% yr/yr to 476k

Outlook

  • Xplora targets entering 4-5 new MVNO markets over the next five years

  • Company expects continued demand in Senior segment into 2026

  • Xplora plans further product and service expansion across all segments

Result Drivers

  • SENIOR SEGMENT INTEGRATION - Integration of the Senior segment and acquisition of Doro AB contributed to revenue growth and improved gross profits

  • PRODUCT LAUNCHES - Launches of Aurora and Leva series drove strong growth in the Senior segment

  • SUBSCRIPTION GROWTH - Subscription base increased by 33% yr/yr to 476k, driving 22% growth in service revenue

Company press release:

  • The stock recently traded at 18 times the next 12-month earnings vs. a P/E of 19 three months ago

data.title: Switzerland's Swiss Re 2025 net income rises 47% on strong underwriting profits
data.description:
Overview

  • The reinsurance provider's 2025 net income rose 47% to record $4.8 bln

  • Company plans $1.5 bln share buyback in 2026, including $500 mln sustainable programme

  • Board proposes 9% dividend increase to $8.00 per share at AGM

Outlook

  • Swiss Re targets 2026 net income of USD 4.5 bln

  • Company maintains combined ratio targets for P&C Re and Corporate Solutions

  • L&H Re targets increased net income of USD 1.7 bln in 2026

Result Drivers

  • UNDERWRITING PROFITS - Strong underwriting profits in property and casualty segments drove record net income, aided by lower-than-expected large natural catastrophe claims

  • PORTFOLIO REVIEW - Completion of L&H Re portfolio review impacted net income, but positioned business for consistent results

  • INVESTMENT RETURNS - Strong return on investments contributed to financial performance, with a 4.0% ROI and positive equity holdings contribution

Company press release:

Key Details

Metric

Beat/Miss

Actual

Consensus Estimate

FY Net Income

$4.80 bln

FY ROE

19.60%

Analyst Coverage

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "hold" and the breakdown of recommendations is 3 "strong buy" or "buy", 10 "hold" and 7 "sell" or "strong sell"

  • The average consensus recommendation for the reinsurance peer group is "buy."

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Swiss Re Ltd is CHF130.00, about 0.8% below its February 26 closing price of CHF131.05

  • The stock recently traded at 11 times the next 12-month earnings vs. a P/E of 11 three months ago
